But this PR doesn't touch `REST.hh` and lines 48 and 52 of that file don't seem to have anything wrong. Let me look more

pullrequest.title: Command line: verbosity and models by user

content.raw: Four means debug information will be printed as well. Is that what you want as the default?
content.html: Four means debug information will be printed as well. Is that what you want as the default?

pullrequest.title: Command line: verbosity and models by user

content.raw:
I just followed the current behaviour of ign-gui, but I agree that a lower default may be better. Also worth considering printing errors even if `-v` is not passed. How about:

* No `-v`: defaults to errors (1?)
* `-v` without arg: defaults to errors, warnings and msgs (3?)

We should also make ign-gui's behaviour match.
content.html:
I just followed the current behaviour of ign-gui, but I agree that a lower default may be better. Also worth considering printing errors even if -v is not passed. How about:

  • No -v: defaults to errors (1?)
  • -v without arg: defaults to errors, warnings and msgs (3?)

We should also make ign-gui's behaviour match.

pullrequest.title: Command line: verbosity and models by user

content.raw:
I think the error levels are:

* 0: No output. 
* 1: errors
* 2: errors + warnings
* 3: errors + warnings + info
* 4: errors + warnings + info + debug

A default value (`-v` not present) of 1 makes sense. 

Is `-v` without an argument valid?
content.html:
I think the error levels are:

  • 0: No output.
  • 1: errors
  • 2: errors + warnings
  • 3: errors + warnings + info
  • 4: errors + warnings + info + debug

A default value (-v not present) of 1 makes sense.

Is -v without an argument valid?

pullrequest.title: Command line: verbosity and models by user

content.raw: Yeah without an argument is what currently defaults to 4, and no `-v` defaults to 0
content.html: Yeah without an argument is what currently defaults to 4, and no -v defaults to 0

pullrequest.title: Command line: verbosity and models by user

content.raw: Okay. Your suggested levels sound good.
content.html: Okay. Your suggested levels sound good.

content.raw: A version number is being applied to the ruby script, and it looks like `ign fuel list` will use the most recent version.  If both version 1 and version 2 of this library is installed, then this is a problem. However, it will go away when we merge forward.
content.html: A version number is being applied to the ruby script, and it looks like ign fuel list will use the most recent version. If both version 1 and version 2 of this library is installed, then this is a problem. However, it will go away when we merge forward.

pullrequest.title: Command line: verbosity and models by user

content.raw:
I was thinking that this was a symptom of a bigger problem, but now I checked that the following works, so I think we're all good:

~~~
$ ign fuel list -t model -o chapulina --force-version 1.0.0
Fetching model list from https://api.ignitionfuel.org...
Received model list (took 1057ms).
https://api.ignitionfuel.org
└── chapulina
    ├── Test box
    ├── Wastebasket
    ├── Cessna C-172
    ├── Fire station (collapsed)
    ├── Beer
    ├── Apartment
    └── Ambulance
1 owners, 7 models
~~~

We probably could handle the invalid option better though:

~~~
$ ign fuel list -o chapulina
/usr/local/lib/ruby/ignition/cmdfuel2.rb:109:in `parse': invalid option: -o (OptionParser::InvalidOption)
	from /usr/local/lib/ruby/ignition/cmdfuel2.rb:132:in `execute'
	from /usr/local/bin/ign:256:in `<main>'
~~~
content.html:
I was thinking that this was a symptom of a bigger problem, but now I checked that the following works, so I think we're all good:

$ ign fuel list -t model -o chapulina --force-version 1.0.0
Fetching model list from https://api.ignitionfuel.org...
Received model list (took 1057ms).
https://api.ignitionfuel.org
└── chapulina
    ├── Test box
    ├── Wastebasket
    ├── Cessna C-172
    ├── Fire station (collapsed)
    ├── Beer
    ├── Apartment
    └── Ambulance
1 owners, 7 models

We probably could handle the invalid option better though:

$ ign fuel list -o chapulina
/usr/local/lib/ruby/ignition/cmdfuel2.rb:109:in `parse': invalid option: -o (OptionParser::InvalidOption)
    from /usr/local/lib/ruby/ignition/cmdfuel2.rb:132:in `execute'
    from /usr/local/bin/ign:256:in `<main>'

Done on 1c7b8c7

The model iter factory pointer magic is beyond my C++ knowledge, I tried reusing more code between the cons and non-const functions but failed, so ended up duplicating a lot of code. Feel free to change it if you have a better idea.

Done on 1c7b8c7

The model iter factory pointer magic is beyond my C++ knowledge, I tried reusing more code between the cons and non-const functions but failed, so ended up duplicating a lot of code. Feel free to change it if you have a better idea.
